website_summaries.verdict: An affordable tuner/metronome from a reputable company. The best bargain around.
pros: Back-lit screen is easy to read

customer_reviews.title: Should I buy a case, too?
customer_reviews.text: Yes, yes you should. I should have done so the first time, too. I learned the error of my ways a couple weeks after my purchase when the instrument case was put down on the metronome giving me the lovely result you can see in the included photo. The tuner works nicely and is pretty intuitive to use. I liked it so well I bought it again! (With a case this time.)
customer_reviews.author: Steve W. Bonds

customer_reviews.title: Great digital metronome
customer_reviews.text: This product worked just as described. The "beep" isn't so much a computerized beep but more like a computerized click, which I like much better than a beep. The only bad thing about the product is the fact that sometimes the power buttons don't want to turn on or off very well, like the button doesn't hit the right spot sometimes or something. But it's a minor issue compared to all the good things this metronome/tuner offers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good Tuner. The problem is the owner's manual
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good Tuner. The problem is the owner's manual. It is written by someone with no clue how to tell others to use the instrument. They assume the users are all experts in instrument tuning. After many trial and guessing, I figured how to use it and get my drums tuned properly. The instrument helped once I learned from the internet how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Sivadasan Madhavan

customer_reviews.title: Very handy tool, use it nearly every time I ...
customer_reviews.text: Very handy tool, use it nearly every time I play music, regardless of instrument. When I feel what note I want to play next but I'm not too sure what it is I'll sing/hum it into this thing, really helps the song writing process flow. Also if you're trying to learn the notes to a song, you can sing/hum it into this and you can learn it 1 note at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Seth B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but would like a higher volume and a way to turn-off the beat counter.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Two things: I concur with other reviewers who reported that the volume, even at maximum setting, is comparatively low. I would appreciate a higher volume. Second, and this is personal; the metronome has both tempo and beat. The metronome makes a different (higher pitched) sound to register the beats-per-measure. I find this highly annoying. There may be an obvious way to turn off this feature, but I have not yet found it.
customer_reviews.author: tlee

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite tuner/metrome
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tuner and metronome. Super easy to use and better yet, super easy to see. It does a good job of registering the correct pitch of even a low B 7th string just using the built in mic. The metronome is loud enough and has enough options to it that go beyond basic 4/4 time. Definitely recommend for anyone needing tuning and metronome for any instrument.
customer_reviews.author: FJK1138

customer_reviews.title: IF you can get beyond that you will enjoy this tool as much as I do
customer_reviews.text: This unit is just what I have needed. I have been away from my horn for 40 years this Korg M50BK is helping me to reestablish my playing ear. I need to study more sound physics. This tool reports sound as "Concert Pitch". So my F is reported as B-flat and Middle C is reported as F. IF you can get beyond that you will enjoy this tool as much as I do.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth f bjornbak

customer_reviews.title: A couple reservations
customer_reviews.text: This gadget has a lot of nice features. There are two things about it I don't like. 1) I find its beep irritating. I would rather the lower-pitched "tock" of a traditional metronome. Maybe there is a way to change it that I don't know about 2) The backlit display is hard to read. I would rather have something larger and clearer. Perhaps that is an unreasonable request at this price point, but those are my two reservations.
customer_reviews.author: Albion Beirut

customer_reviews.title: The standard to be beat
customer_reviews.text: This Korg multi-function device is the standard that all other tuner/metronomes aspire to be. I bought two - for both myself and my son, who is learning violin. Haven't ever had any issues either one, and it has a lot of really useful features a practicing musician might need. It's not a flaw, but the only thing that would improve on the value would be for them to include the clip-on mic for tuning in loud environments. We already had one, so it's there just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A

customer_reviews.title: Not good for guitars tuned lower than standard tuning.  Unit can't decide between D or B flat.
customer_reviews.text: I normally tune my guitars down a whole step. This tuner handles it fine except for the high (D) string. When I strike the high string, the display jumps back and forth between D and B flat, usually ending up where it seems to settle on B flat. Tuning to center the needle winds up giving me a slightly flat D. So I have to tune that string by ear. This is specifically happening while using the tuner's built in microphone. I don't know whether or not the same behavior is exhibited if you plug in an electric guitar.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: ... th century French double harpsichord and this is the perfect device for tuning
customer_reviews.text: I have replica 18 th century French double harpsichord and this is the perfect device for tuning. You can change the A=440 to anything you desire if needed. The unit then will provide a tone for a start and then the display will show what any key is playing and indicates when you are spot on for the key being tuned. It has other features which I don't use. My only slightly negative comment is that the tones it generates don't sound like a nice sine wave like a tuning fork provides. This isn't a big deal to me since it will then show what you are getting after you have set your instrument to the tone.
customer_reviews.author: gh

customer_reviews.title: Great Tuner
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 13 year old who plays the Cello - My 11 year old's music teacher told her this is the tuner to use on all instruments and she has one of her own - It works great - She can now tune her own Cello whenever it's out of tune - Would definitely recommend and would definitely buy again from this seller - Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Yankeegirl831

customer_reviews.title: This tool provides the two functions as advertised and the ...
customer_reviews.text: This tool provides the two functions as advertised and the selection controls are simple to learn and to use. I appreciate the convenience of having the tuner function as well as the metronome function in one tool. Now that I have been using it, I wish that it had the more wooden strike tone but that doesn't diminish it's usefulness.
customer_reviews.author: S. R. Woody

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Meh! I really was rather disappointed with this metronome. The main problem that I found was that it is not loud enough, though I was only playing a nylon acoustic guitar. Also the tone was kind of funky. I much prefer an app that I bought for $0.99 from the app store. If all you need is a metronome, buy the app and save yourself some money.
customer_reviews.author: Gedunk

customer_reviews.title: If you're getting this to practice with a banjo...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this more than I actually do. It's not loud enough (even if you have the volume up at its highest) if you are using it for practicing banjo rolls. You end up having to play very softly to hear the metronome. I suppose I could attach it (via the headphone jack) to a speaker, but that kind of defeats its portability. I'll use my Cherub and sigh and use this when I absolutely have to, but do be aware of its volume limitations. Otherwise it's a very trick little unit. Maybe I'll grow to like it better. Who knows?
customer_reviews.author: L. Bullock

customer_reviews.title: Great product and Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 9yrs old and I bought this for her. She says it is very easy to use and is really helpful when tuning her violin. She likes that it has an AUX port so she can plug it in to her speaker for her to hear it better when she is playing.
customer_reviews.author: CandyLynn

customer_reviews.title: Great little metronome/tuner!
customer_reviews.text: This metronome/tuner really is a great little device. It has all the features I need, and it is accurate and compact. This is the second one I've bought; now I have one in my flute bag, and one in my sax case. I've noticed that many musicians I play with have this as well!
customer_reviews.author: nana D

customer_reviews.title: I love this little tuner
customer_reviews.text: I love this little tuner. It works great for guitars. One guy said it didn't. Wrong. And with the korg clip sensor it's even more accurate. Yes you can tune to A 432hz no problem. I found my acoustic instruments sounded softer and more pleasant. I was already detuning my electric anyway so I didn't notice a change. This thing makes detuning easy as well. I like the metronome but I don't use it. Just a bonus. Basically this was everything I wanted when I got the korg GA-1. It's basic. This one does it all. And the seller was great. Fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Oeda B.

customer_reviews.title: Good tool.
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that it seems a little slow to respond to the sound and give a reading about its intonation. Otherwise, it’s a good tool. I use it with a pickup so others tuning do not mean I can’t tune.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen F

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. The tuner is great, I really like the visual indicators. My only complaint is The metronome element is to quiet even at max volume to be heard when I’m scraping away on my fiddle.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: I love KORG <3
customer_reviews.text: I have always used Korg for all of my Instrument Tuning needs. They always provide high quality products, super fast Amazon Prime shipping and have a wonderful support team that will help you out in any way possible. These devices are built very well and are some of the most precise devices on the market. I defiantly recommended them to anyone looking for an instrument Tuner. The Built-in Metronome can also come in handy for tricky songs! It is very loud and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: MrGeek

customer_reviews.title: Decent tuner/metronome combo
customer_reviews.text: Better than its predecessor, the Korg TM50 is a decent metronome/tuner in one device. I like the lighted meter, and (unlike it's predecessor) the metronome and tuner work when both are turned on, although some of the complex rhythms for the metronome are disabled when the tuner is active. The 'sound back' function is an interesting feature, but of limited use if you're already using the metronome. In any case, it is still better than trying to travel with two devices.
customer_reviews.author: David G. Silberberg

customer_reviews.title: Wrong item... twice!
customer_reviews.text: The description on this item is for the Korg TM-50, which is what I wanted. It is slightly different to the TM-60, and I prefer the earlier model. However, I received the TM-60, which I returned, with a comment that I received the wrong item. The new one arrived, and it's still the TM-60. I'm bummed. Somehow this item is either mislabeled in their warehouse, or in the description. Either way, it's wasting my time. I can feel it slipping away like clicks on the wrong metronome.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ward

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tool! I love the chromatic tuner because it works with my instruments of choice ... electric and acoustic guitars and harmonicas. The metronome is keeps solid time. I like the large display that can be back lit and I like the volume control. I don't mind the electronic chirp. I like the way it stands at a good angle. The earplug/headphone jack is also a plus. All this at a great price too! I would recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Wheels

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Competent, Intuitive
customer_reviews.text: One of the nicest things you can mention in a review is NO UNPLEASANT SURPRISES. And I can undoubtedly write that about this tuner and metronome. But hey, what do you expect from Korg? Simplicity, quality, durability. All present and accounted for.
customer_reviews.author: John Burkitt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit for the price.
customer_reviews.text: My son's band directors made it mandatory that they acquire this model, I can see why. There are many really nice features that help a musician. Tuning works really well and seems to be spot on. The metronome function is easy to use, the unit is small enough to sit on a music stand so you can make use of the visual features. My son uses it every day, I am expecting to get one for my younger son for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Really Distracted

customer_reviews.title: which tends to be annoying especially while wearing headphones which I do because the ...
customer_reviews.text: Handy tool for practicing. I haven't had a chance to figure out whether for the metronome if there is anything other than beeps, which tends to be annoying especially while wearing headphones which I do because the speaker is weak and I play trumpet so the high pitch beans are just drowned out. Not sure why they didn't use synthesized drum it really only needs 2 sounds. My other problem with it is the metronome only moves up by set intervals skipping certain bpm which I really don't understand some of the music I play are to be played in times that don't exist on the metronome so you have to compromise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like having the metronome
customer_reviews.text: Like having the metronome, but have to improvise on uneven beats. You can only get so far in music before you need a metronome to get the sound and timing you want. Definitely a good tuner for the irregular instrument tunings.
customer_reviews.author: Herman Deyette

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Does a decent job. I was even able to use to set the intonation on a guitar and it got me very close. But is a guitar ever really in tune?......lol
customer_reviews.author: Richard Moore

customer_reviews.title: Too soft
customer_reviews.text: Really convenient and user-friendly design. The tuning function is a bonus. However the timing beats are too soft for my daughter to hear over her own playing (violin). It is significantly softer as compared to the more expensive KORG model that her teacher uses. Kind of defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Lim

customer_reviews.title: Like the price
customer_reviews.text: Like the price, and my students find it easy to use for tuning. Metronome works well too. Lightweight, easy to tote around. The screen is small, if that is an issue for you buy a different one. Would buy again, and recommend to parents for their young musician.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. J.

customer_reviews.title: Piano Buyers Beware -- Volume May Likely Be Not Loud Enough.
customer_reviews.text: This review is specifically only for pianists: The metronome click is not loud enough to be used with a piano. The tuner function is good. All other functions work well.
customer_reviews.author: AstuteBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great price and product
customer_reviews.text: Great price and great item, this will help my daughter now as a beginner throughout high school and beyond
customer_reviews.author: Jamie King

customer_reviews.title: Nice tuner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a super nice tuner! I love all the different features that it has. You can adjust the brightness of the screen, you can tap out the beat you're thinking of for the metronome, so if you have a tempo in mind, you don't have to try and figure out what number it is. It comes in cool colors, mine is red, I love it because it's easy to find in the dark recesses of my backpack! I also like the little stand it has on the back so it can balance better on things.
customer_reviews.author: Familia Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My son has played double bass for just under a couple of years. His instructor suggested we get this. It was a great purchase. It is easy to use, and I like that he can use it as both a tuner and a metronome.
customer_reviews.author: book lover

customer_reviews.title: The metronome is not very loud.
customer_reviews.text: Not loud enough and the function buttons sometimes have to be pressed two or three times before they respond. Tuner is typical for that price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Different model shipped.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly but I Ordered TM50 and received a TM60 instead. This works fine and does the same things we need so Iwe are keeping However it does not fit carry case for TM50.
customer_reviews.author: JohnR

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not loud enough.
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping for more volume from the click. Otherwise, it's fine. Really though I get a much better sound form the app I use on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, wish it was louder
customer_reviews.text: who really likes metronomes anyway? well, we intend to use this bad boy to beat the tempo into our subconscious......so far, it's working but if you play fairly loudly (strumming, etc.) it gets a bit tricky to hear the tone. It is great at adjusting the tones especially like making the first note of the tempo higher than the others, but it is still (IMO) kind of quiet (especially on the slower beats per minute). Other than that, for the price, the performance and the ease of use it's solid. So get your groove on and get the tempo down!
customer_reviews.author: Pam Greenwell

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this unit as a metronome. It just simply isn't loud enough. On full volume, my old Korg MA1 metronome is much louder. A quiet metronome is about useless.
customer_reviews.author: R. Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Typical excellent Korg design.  Very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12 year old daughter to use in her first year of band class learning to play the flute. I also purchased the CM–L100 clip on mic because I know she will need the isolation to tune such a quiet instrument in a large and unruly first-year band room. She had no problem immediately grasping how it functions thanks to Korg's experience in design. It's all very intuitive. I am a professional musician and really can't find any fault with it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Yianilos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tuner and metronome for my 12 year old bassist
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tuner and metronome. I bought this for my 12 year that plays bass in the orchestra. He was using an iPhone app to tune with, but it struggled to pick up the bass when all the other instruments were trying to tune as well. This one works perfectly. The built in metronome is a bonus. My husband has asked me to order him one to replace is old Korg tuner. So I'll be ordering another. Excellent quality and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.S

customer_reviews.title: Tuner & Metronome
customer_reviews.text: This works as described. The volume control doesn't get as loud as I would prefer it to, but it does what I need it to do. It is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Theaterdreamer

customer_reviews.title: AN ESSENTIAL!
customer_reviews.text: This little number has it all - tuner and metronome! The tuner is perfect for symphony orchestra use, allowing the musician to calibrate the tuning "A" to the once standard 440 to the ever increasing 442 or (oh dear) higher or lower (for Baroque pitch). Double bass tuning is easy and accurate. It goes with me to every rehearsal and concert.
customer_reviews.author: SDP

customer_reviews.title: Good item with slow shipping
customer_reviews.text: very Easy to use after I checked the video tutorial and I like it , I’m giving 4 Star because I’m prime member n I waited a week to receive the item
customer_reviews.author: Sweetbabe

customer_reviews.title: Lovely little tuner!
customer_reviews.text: came packaged wonderfully with a set of batteries! I highly recommend this product, it tunes my cello and dads guitars great!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Standard Korg Excellence
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Korg brand tuners since forever and they have always made a quality product. I wanted something small that could pull double duty and this fit the bill perfectly. The screen is easy to read and clear. Multiple options on the metronome setting (like pitch of beat noise, and a different sound for beat 1 if desired) make this an easy device to work with. The tuner picks up sound well. You can turn on either part of the machine or both at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Ej

customer_reviews.title: A Lot of Power in a Small Package
customer_reviews.text: This little gem does a great job in tuning just about any instrument. As for the metronome function, the old Maelzel (Winkler)type can't do different time signatures -but this offers 0 to 9, plus duplets, triplets, quadruplets, and these last 2 without center beats if selected. It offers an audio input with a detection range from C1-C8, plus a headphone output. I'm sure I'll find even more uses for this unit in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Tenther1

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device. I just started taking clarinet lessons and thought all my note sounded flat. I was able to see if I was sharp or flat quite easily with this. I did find I got better readings by using the microphone that clips to the bell (microphone sold separately). I have just tried the metronome feature briefly but think I will probably use it more later on (like when I start playing actual music!)
customer_reviews.author: GeeBLateTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise the controls are good and this is pretty good unit but I give ...
customer_reviews.text: When in metronome setting the needle does not show fully but maybe 3 or so to tick on mine. The volume control does not go up enough to hear the sound loud enough for me. Otherwise the controls are good and this is pretty good unit but I give three due to above reasons on this particular unit.
customer_reviews.author: MiB

customer_reviews.title: and it is EXCELLENT. I was skeptical about the beeping sound because ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the metronome, and it is EXCELLENT. I was skeptical about the beeping sound because I'm used to a hard, percussive wood block sound from a Sabine Zipbeat. It turns out the beep is plenty percussive enough and I actually like it much more. Tempo selection is quick. The volume control is great for quiet practice, and the different accents/rhythms are nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Al Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine. Beep a little annoying.
customer_reviews.text: It tunes, it counts time, it works just fine. The only thing I'd like better is if the metronome had a "Tick, Tick" setting rather than a "Beep, Beep" setting, but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Lilley

customer_reviews.title: and they are easy to use and are great teaching tools
customer_reviews.text: Korg metronomes and tuners are my favorites over the many years I have taught privately. I purchased these for my students, and they are easy to use and are great teaching tools.
customer_reviews.author: Keyman

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy-to-use metronome for gigs, click sound adjustable for fast audible click to get BPM before song!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a reference when we play, to get the right BPM for songs. We play many different songs, and I wanted to make sure we're close to the appropriate speed when playing, after we had played a couple songs either too fast or too slow on occasion. Went through and matched up BPM to all our songs, made notes, and at a gig, set this to the BPM from my notes, and play it for a few seconds for guitar player and myself to hear. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: VTstuff C.

customer_reviews.title: Love the red color since it adds some color to ...
customer_reviews.text: I had only seen this tuner/metronome combo in black or gray before, so I was surprised to find it offered in several more colors on Amazon. Love the red color since it adds some color to my music practice but it is unique and more distinguishable!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Balderrama

customer_reviews.title: Versatile tuner with good sensitivity.  Metronome feature in demand in classroom enviroment.  Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my granddaughter oboeist. Works well for tuning. Especially useful due to metronome feature. Easy on batteries. Great buy for the price ($20 range).
customer_reviews.author: r2pabq

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love it, feels very well built, better then the picture makes you think. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Grecco de Leon

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very durable. I bought this three years ago when my son was 7. Now he's 10, he used it everyday and dropped it just about every day. And it still works perfectly. Five star.
customer_reviews.author: Jie Hou

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this not knowing how to use it but it turns out to be fairly simple.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to just about everything you'd need to practice with.
customer_reviews.text: This thing does it all, Tune, Pitches, Tempo all in various ways. Has it's own kick stand, light, custom ways of achieving Metronome. Even has input for contact Mic or any other 1/4" jack, and 3mm output for headphones or speakers. Great price and Korg is a leader in the industry. Couldn't be happier with this. It's also pretty small so easily mobile.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Clear and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: I teach private lessons. This tuner is essential for what I do
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I play using this device. It is portable, so I always have it with me. I tune the A to 432, and this works well for that. Has a tuner and a metronome. What's not to love. Best to carry a cable to plug into the guitar, unless you are in a quiet area. It is sensitive, and will pick up ambient sounds to give false readings. This is a good thing: it's sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Mick Mack

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Had gotten compliments for its color, as it seems like people tend to go for the black. Very good companion for practice.
customer_reviews.author: SB17

customer_reviews.title: This is easy for everyone to use
customer_reviews.text: This is easy for everyone to use. Many months later it still works just like it should. My wife would have liked the black model, but I like the white one fine.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Love it but get the Clip attachment.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only tuner that will tune my double bass and my Lyre reliably. You do want the optional vibration pickup clip. It makes all the difference in a noisy room and is wide enough to tune anything. I like it better than the "orchestra tuner". I wish the metronome clicked instead of beeped, but you can't have everything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple and functional
customer_reviews.text: It’s a small little product. It does what is supposed to do. The sound through the speaker is loud enough. I am giving four stars for being cheap “plasticky.” I hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Great little tuner
customer_reviews.text: Great little tuner. I keep it in my road case and it doesn't let me down. The batteries last for a long time. The backlight is good for dark stages and it's easy to use. It also has a metronome which is a good incentive to tune every time you practice and to really keep your time. This is a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Cory Flintoff

customer_reviews.title: Simple and functional tuning tool
customer_reviews.text: We first learned of this tuner from the teacher who is instructing our boys in violin. We now use it on a regular basis to help keep violins in tune. It's simple to understand and is easy to use. The included metronome is helpful for teaching and handy to have as part of the tuning device. This is a good compliment for our string instruments and the cost seems to be appropriate for the quality of the tool. We're glad we purchased this tuner are are pleased with it's function.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great tuner, contact sold separately.
customer_reviews.text: Great tuner with tons of customization. But be warned- if you're playing this in a band or in a loud setting, you will need a contact tuner to attach to it (They are inexpensive though). Lots of useful features and extremely accurate.
customer_reviews.author: iamjoeyr

customer_reviews.title: No warranty from unauthorized dealers
customer_reviews.text: Onetoone is not an authorized Korg dealer. When the product fails, Korg will not honor the warranty. We bought 3 of these and 2 of them failed within the 5 year warranty period. Onetoone only replaces for 30 days. Go to Korg website for a list of authorized dealers and they will replace your tuner when it fails.
customer_reviews.author: momofthree

customer_reviews.title: Must have.
customer_reviews.text: Great price and value esp. if you have prime. It's Easy to use and an essential for any beginner or intermediate level player, frankly perfect for anyone learning, practicing or teaching.
customer_reviews.author: Melz

customer_reviews.title: Great tuner!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my old one. The screen cracked on my old one. :( I love this device though, so I bought a new one. Aslo ordered a case for it so it could stay safe. I play all sorts of brass and wind instruments and it works great on all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Chase

customer_reviews.title: A solid tuner that is so versatile.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite tuner that I've owned. Being able to record your beats, be a metronome, and also tune your instrument is amazing. I love the professional look and I consider this relatively cheap tuner/metronome for the quality it provides.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper

customer_reviews.title: horrible metronome sound !!!!!!!!!  - not very loud with volume on high - acoustic guitar can bury it
customer_reviews.text: horrible lone metronome sound !!!!!!!!! - not very loud with volume on high - acoustic guitar can bury it - come on korg grrrrrr
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: We have not bought her a smart phone so she could not download a tuner app
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who is in her high school band,(percussion). We have not bought her a smart phone so she could not download a tuner app. This works wonderful. She just loves it and it is in her hand everyday when I pick her up from Band. And I also found another reason not to buy her a smart phone!
customer_reviews.author: B. Dolter

customer_reviews.title: Annoying sound great metronome/tuner
customer_reviews.text: Great metronome and tuner. Good for keeping tempo and practicing pitch blending of intonation. The only reason I'm not giving five stars is because the sound is so annoying for the tones
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tuner. The volume needs to go higher
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tuner. The volume needs to go higher, and the different beats is limited selection, they should have more options. It is also a gas guzzler.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to quickly tune a Gibson. Never sounded right though. Bought a Snark clamp on Turner and compared the sound. Now this is back in the box and used as a paper weight
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bradford

customer_reviews.title: does what it should.
customer_reviews.text: got this for the metronome only. does what i need it to do. like the headphone jack very useful to hear over my awful piano playing.don't understand the tick sound though when ticking a triplet, maybe just me. i like to put it in my shirt pocket when i use it and the red led is very visible when i don;t want to hear it.l no comment on the tuner aspect since i have no use for it. scott
customer_reviews.author: J A. Pelger

customer_reviews.title: Korg Tuner
customer_reviews.text: This is the tuner to get. Mic or audio jack input and a metronome to practice with. The tick of the metronome is loud enough to practice with an acoustic or an electric as long as you don't like to turn it up to 11 (but you could just use the visual needle or light blink if you don't care to hear the tick).
customer_reviews.author: Brent Richard Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great for tech work
customer_reviews.text: Much better and more accurate than the clip on type. Especially when restringing or floating a bridge or where more needle accuracy is required.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Dee

customer_reviews.title: I downloaded an app for her and it works much better.
customer_reviews.text: my daughter hates it, she says this is unusable. It sits there collecting dust until she gives it another try and gives up. I downloaded an app for her and it works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Keeping in tune
customer_reviews.text: I lost my other one about two months ago after several years and really missed having it. So this new one was very similar and easy to use. It helps me to tune my instrument every week. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Linda L Dorman

customer_reviews.title: Metronome's sound is too low to be of great use. Earphone's aren't working properly
customer_reviews.text: Metronome's sound is too low to be of great use. Earphone's aren't working properly. One of them doesn't work at all; the other is compromised by poor sound quality. On the other hand, for someone who doesn't use the earphones and can use the visual beat it's adequate for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: neal

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tuner, makes tuning a 12-string guitar easy!
customer_reviews.text: I tune a 12-string guitar, so this tuner REALLY helps me! I have had Korg digital tuners for decades, and the one I had from the 1980s finally had enough LEDs go out so I bought this one, and I LOVE this one! It is easy to use, easy to see, and works great! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: John Carter

customer_reviews.title: A good choice for me. An excellent electronic musical instrument that makes sure the instrument performs well for the artist
customer_reviews.text: A good choice for me. An excellent electronic musical instrument that makes sure the instrument performs well for the artist
customer_reviews.author: Steven O'Marro

customer_reviews.title: Music minor in college: great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to be a music minor in college (oboe player c:). I originally had a tuner and separate metronome. This product combines the two functions perfectly. Fair price point for the quality product I received.
customer_reviews.author: Esther L.

customer_reviews.title: Dual functionality
customer_reviews.text: Have always loved Korgs & the red color is a plus. Professional musician with a teaching studio & still prefer tuner/metronome to apps.
customer_reviews.author: R. Evans

customer_reviews.title: and this one the great tuners out there that is worth your money
customer_reviews.text: Any musician should own a tuner regardless of what instrument they play, and this one the great tuners out there that is worth your money. My only problem with it is that is doesn't go up by ones, it often skips by three or four beats per minute (96 to 100 bpm)
customer_reviews.author: Alexander J. Ragsdale

customer_reviews.title: I love that I can clip it onto my cello bridge ...
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can clip it onto my cello bridge and it allows me to accurately tune all strings without resetting the note as it adjust to whatever pitch you play.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Kashdan

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and battery lasts a long time
customer_reviews.text: I love my Korg tuner. It works like a dream and battery seems to last a long time. I have had this tuner for months and practice three hours a day. The battery is still going. It seems to be accurate And has plenty of variety in settings.
customer_reviews.author: CindyY

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is the baseline for professional tuners. I don't play without it. The metronome settings, while not always the most precise in terms of what I want to achieve, get the job done for daly use. However, the best thing about this tuner is that the sound is not limited to a single octave, but can reach the natural ranges of most instruments, which is a feature lacking on a many metronome/tuners. A necessity on a music stand, this tuner really is the best of the cheap.
customer_reviews.author: P W

customer_reviews.title: Great metronome
customer_reviews.text: This metronome has all the features you would want and the operation buttons are clear and easy to adjust. It doesn't have many beat sounds but the ones included are distinctive. I purchased three different products with similar features and this is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: heidi

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but sound is beepy
customer_reviews.text: No real complaints other than the beep sound which is a little more beepy than I like. Would prefer a tick or chirp more.
customer_reviews.author: Zapp Brannigan

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, easy to use, durable.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for an everyday musician, everything works great. The internal microphone has some issues picking up the E string on my mandolin and guitar, but works great for my electric and upright bass. Love the 1/4" input, can't seem to get the headphones to work, but haven't messed around with it too much.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah Wright

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift idea.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two a year ago for our grandkids in middle and high school bands. Both like them for tuning their instruments. Still working. Visual display of the degree of being in tune. Also provides an audible tone to compare.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie & Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works great for someone who plays harp
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my granddaughter who plays the harp. She says it is easy to use and likes it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Hummingbird

customer_reviews.title: Great little tuner and metronome.
customer_reviews.text: I use this regularly for my 5-string bass. Friction mounted tuners do not seem to pick up the lowest 2 strings on my basses, but since this one receives a signal straight from the pickups, there is little room for failure. I have only tried out the metronome a couple times, but it's easy to use also.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: I use it for my practice out from home
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my practice out from home, It is a lightweight and economic modern option in compairson to the very expensive ones. I apreciatte it the most specially when I need to tune my instruments and keep the pace while giving lessons, It is a wonderful device
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Treviño

customer_reviews.title: ... it and I decided to keep it because I like having a standalone piece of equipment that I can ...
customer_reviews.text: After I bought this I thought I could have just used an app on my phone but then I gave it a chance and used it and I decided to keep it because I like having a standalone piece of equipment that I can just leave in my saxophone case and not have to use my phone for a metronome
customer_reviews.author: Nicademus

product_meta.title: Korg TM50BK Instrument Tuner and Metronome, Black
feature_bullets: Tuner and metronome can be used simultaneously or independently
Newly designed highly responsive LCD needle-type meter
2 AAA Batteries Required (not included, best with Polaroid AAA Batteries)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,659 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
